item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 19, 2025 at 7:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Goboscript, text-based programming language, compiles to Scratch (41 points | 9 comments)
2. New research reveals the strongest solar event ever detected, in 12350 BC (152 points | 73 comments)
3. Spaced repetition systems have gotten better (833 points | 443 comments)
4. “There are people who can see and others who cannot even look” (109 points | 16 comments)
5. InventWood is about to mass-produce wood that's stronger than steel (14 points | 7 comments)
6. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (314 points | 332 comments)
7. Layers All the Way Down: The Untold Story of Shader Compilation (38 points | 13 comments)
8. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (325 points | 97 comments)
9. Llama from scratch (2023) (12 points | discuss)
10. Font Activations: A Note on the Type (26 points | discuss)
11. France Endorses UN Open Source Principles (391 points | 88 comments)
12. Show HN: Job board aggregator for best paying remote SWE jobs in the U.S. (42 points | 34 comments)
13. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (242 points | 108 comments)
14. The principles of database design, or, the Truth is out there (51 points | 42 comments)
15. The Connoisseur of Desire (17 points | discuss)
16. Spaced Repetition Memory System (211 points | 19 comments)
17. Show HN: Vaev – A browser engine built from scratch (It renders google.com) (173 points | 97 comments)
18. `This Printer company served you malware for months, called them false positives (11 points | discuss)
19. Show HN: A platform to find tech conferences, discounts, and ticket giveaways (62 points | 21 comments)
20. Hyper Typing (77 points | 55 comments)
21. K-Scale Labs: Open-source humanoid robots, built for developers (88 points | 41 comments)
22. The Tongue Is a Fire (17 points | 6 comments)
23. First successful demonstration of quantum error correction of qudits (5 points | discuss)
24. Comparing Parallel Functional Array Languages: Programming and Performance (70 points | 12 comments)
25. The Fall of Roam (2022) (111 points | 58 comments)
26. Show HN: Python Simulator of David Deutsch’s “Constructor Theory of Time” (65 points | 7 comments)
27. What do wealthy people buy, that ordinary people know nothing about? (2015) (129 points | 184 comments)
28. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (193 points | 23 comments)
29. Mystical (390 points | 44 comments)
30. Publisher: The Malloy Semantic Model Server (16 points | discuss)
